intro: Molinaea laevis, commonly known as the smooth mole plant, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure. The plant features small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters during the spring and summer months. Its leaves are simple, ovate, and covered in a fine, smooth texture. Molinaea laevis thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in shaded forest understories.
